column4: ha didn't see you just made the same suggestion, would have saved me some typing :)
yours was more clear I kind of rambled in there
-i will edit the file in place if you don't give it a parameter
yeah I'm always wary of doing that though, like to check that the files look ok first
nice, I'll have to try that next time
well, that would skip every dot in a file name, wouldn't it?
.[^.]* for files beginning with '.' and having second character non-dot and then    ..?*  for files beginning with .. and having second character . (and you don't want ..)
oh I see, for some reason I assumed the glob would apply to [^.], yeah that would be a better way
klingelbart: nautilus will also hide files listed in a .hidden file
oh can you specify that an app only starts for a certain session in a .desktop?
a couple of the xdg autostart files have it but it isn't well documented unfortunately
